intro: Richardsonia sericea, commonly known as the silky Richardsonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a silky, hair-like coating, giving it its common name. Richardsonia sericea is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
